title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Archegos's founder and its finance chief were indicted on securities fraud and racketeering charges for what prosecutors said was a fraud and manipulation scheme that nearly jeopardized the U.S. financial system.

---

Facebook parent Meta added more users than expected in the latest quarter but posted its slowest revenue growth since going public.

---

Boeing reported a quarterly loss of $1.24 billion amid more setbacks for the company's jetliner and military programs.

---

Samsung Electronics posted record quarterly revenue and saw its net profit jump by 59%.

---

The S&P 500 and Dow both closed 0.2% higher in a choppy session, while the Nasdaq slipped 1.81 points.

---

Some big pharmacies have blocked or delayed prescriptions over the last year from clinicians working for telehealth startups that have sprung up to treat ADHD.

---

Musk, whose takeover bid for Twitter was accepted days ago, continued to use the site to criticize executives there.

---

A Delaware judge cleared Musk of unlawful activity in Tesla's roughly $2.1 billion takeover of SolarCity.

---

An SEC proposal intended to make Treasury markets more resilient has sparked a backlash from cryptocurrency companies.

---

Ford swung to a first-quarter loss of $3.1 billion, largely driven by a steep loss in valuation of its stake in Rivian.
